definition: to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff

sentences.english: But He perceived their craftiness and said to them.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣看出他们的诡诈，就对他们说。

sentences.english: He is a merchant, the balances of deceit are in his hand: he loveth to oppress.
sentences.chinese: 以法莲是商人，手里有诡诈的天平，爱行欺骗。

sentences.english: The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?
sentences.chinese: 人心比万物都诡诈，坏到极处，谁能识透呢。

sentences.english: For I knew that you would deal very treacherously And would be called a transgressor from the womb.
sentences.chinese: 我原知道你行事极其诡诈，你从母腹里便称为悖逆的。

sentences.english: Because of new technology, scams have become even trickier to detect.
sentences.chinese: 因为新科技，骗钱术变得更诡诈而难以侦测。

sentences.english: For such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 那等人是假使徒，行事诡诈，装作基督使徒的模样。

sentences.english: And in every sort of evil that deceives those who are perishing .
sentences.chinese: 并且在那沉沦的人身上，行各样出于不义的诡诈。

sentences.english: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
sentences.chinese: 你口任说恶言，你舌编造诡诈。

sentences.english: Will you speak deceitfully for him?
Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.
sentences.chinese: 他虽用诡诈遮掩自己的怨恨，他的邪恶必在会中显露。

sentences.english: You love every harmful word, O you deceitful tongue!
sentences.chinese: 诡诈的舌头阿，你爱说一切毁灭的话。

sentences.english: 4He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to an idol or swear by what is false.
sentences.chinese: 就是手洁心清，不向虚妄，起誓不怀诡诈的人。

sentences.english: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.
sentences.chinese: 邪恶在其中，欺压和诡诈不离街市。

sentences.english: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;
sentences.chinese: 我若与虚谎同行，脚若追随诡诈。

sentences.english: Oneway Normandyis comparable to go is the fact that the deception is involved.
sentences.chinese: 与围棋相比，诺曼底实际上是运用了诡诈之术。

sentences.english: I wanted to inject a little humor and quirkiness into the film.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他在影片中注入一点幽默和诡诈。

definition: deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning
